alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Crawford, northern Sebastian, Haskell, northeastern McIntosh, Sequoyah, northern Le Flore and southeastern Muskogee Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 845 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Porum to 2 miles east of Sallisaw to 2 miles southwest of Short. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Stigler... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Checotah... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Warner... Vian... Panama... Gore... Porum... Webbers Falls... Bonanza... Keota... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 263 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
